intro: Psiadia marojejyensis, commonly known as the Marojejy psiadia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and unique inflorescence structure. The plant is distinguished by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is endemic to the Marojejy National Park, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat-specific requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
